page.title: 05How the Sewage Works
page.content: Conditions in the growing town of {Leeds}in the early 19th century were unbelievably bad by modern standards. The same area, according to one contemporary observer, had only two simple{privies}to serve 380 people. Now we can expect better treatment! For the benefit of the "flush and forget" fraternity, this is what happens: (1) raw sewage enters {Knostrop}works; (2) it is filtered to separate wood, rags and grit; (3) suspended solids are settled out in a primary tank; (4) effluent is passed through a biological filter process: naturally formed microbes destroy {bacteria;}(5) effluent is held in a final settlement tank before being discharged into the river.
